tags: there’s more i could say but....i am v tired
summary: funny how if brie larson says some vaguely liberal stuff, the movie is suddenly “political propaganda,” ignoring the fact that...
body:
funny how if brie larson says some vaguely liberal stuff, the movie is suddenly “political propaganda,” ignoring the fact that a) comics have ALWAYS been political and b) men like chris evans and mark ruffalo are very much outspoken liberals and progressives, and no one is calling any other marvel movie “liberal propaganda”

like….just watch im1 again….shit’s ALWAYS been political, but now a pretty woman who ‘doesn’t smile enough’ says that there should be more diversity on a press tour and bigots everywhere are foaming at the mouth

reblog.comment:
funny how if brie larson says some vaguely liberal stuff, the movie is suddenly “political propaganda,” ignoring the fact that a) comics have ALWAYS been political and b) men like chris evans and mark ruffalo are very much outspoken liberals and progressives, and no one is calling any other marvel movie “liberal propaganda”

like….just watch im1 again….shit’s ALWAYS been political, but now a pretty woman who ‘doesn’t smile enough’ says that there should be more diversity on a press tour and bigots everywhere are foaming at the mouth

trail.content_raw:
funny how if brie larson says some vaguely liberal stuff, the movie is suddenly “political propaganda,” ignoring the fact that a) comics have ALWAYS been political and b) men like chris evans and mark ruffalo are very much outspoken liberals and progressives, and no one is calling any other marvel movie “liberal propaganda”

like….just watch im1 again….shit’s ALWAYS been political, but now a pretty woman who ‘doesn’t smile enough’ says that there should be more diversity on a press tour and bigots everywhere are foaming at the mouth
trail.content:
funny how if brie larson says some vaguely liberal stuff, the movie is suddenly “political propaganda,” ignoring the fact that a) comics have ALWAYS been political and b) men like chris evans and mark ruffalo are very much outspoken liberals and progressives, and no one is calling any other marvel movie “liberal propaganda”

like….just watch im1 again….shit’s ALWAYS been political, but now a pretty woman who ‘doesn’t smile enough’ says that there should be more diversity on a press tour and bigots everywhere are foaming at the mouth

blog.name: neatmonsterr
blog.title: we are all lonely.
blog.description:
Amaya. 30s. This is a very multifandom mess, that's been quite focused on Jon Bernthal for a while now.

I like to make stuff, check out my content here.

And feel free to send me requests (gifs, graphics, icons...) preferably from any of my fandoms *if it's Jon related I'll probably fill it faster, just saying* you can tag me on anything if you like, tracking: #neatmonsterr.

blog.description:
Nagita. 25. Virgo. Ravenclaw. Daughter of Hades.
This is a multi-fandom blog. But I primarily post Marvel, Lucifer, The Walking Dead, and Captain Swan.

Anything else is whatever actor I'm currently obsessed with (this month it’s Pablo Schreiber) and any randomness I find amusing.

My Tags ~ My Fics ~ My Cosplay

summary: The biggest troll of Captain Marvel
body:
The biggest troll of Captain Marvel

Would be if Fury just doesn’t loose his eye.

He makes all these comments “my eyes on you” / “sharp eye, but mine are sharper” etc etc

It’s shown that his depth perception is amazing because he has to through lots of things and land them perfectly

And then the movie just ends ?? and the credits are important but not him losing an eye ??

reblog.comment:

It’s shown that his depth perception is amazing because he has to through lots of things and land them perfectly

And then the movie just ends ?? and the credits are important but not him losing an eye ??

And then the movie just ends ?? and the credits are important but not him losing an eye ??

summary: “breathin” by Ariana Grande - Steve/Peggy Comparison
title: “breathin” by Ariana Grande - Steve/Peggy Comparison
body:
Sometimes it’s hard to find, find my way up into the clouds

Tune it out, they can be so loud

You remind me of a time when things weren’t so complicated
All I need is to see your face

Feel my blood runnin’, swear the sky’s fallin’
How do I know if this shit’s fabricated, oh?

Time goes by and I can’t control my mind


Don’t know what else to try, but you tell me every time

Time goes by and I can’t control my mind


Don’t know what else to try, but you tell me every time

All I need is to see your face

Feel my blood runnin’, swear the sky’s fallin’

Don’t know what else to try, but you tell me every time

Don’t know what else to try, but you tell me every time

summary: pls can someone tell me where brie larson explicitly said she doesn’t want white men watching captain marvel ???????? pretty...
body: pls can someone tell me where brie larson explicitly said she doesn’t want white men watching captain marvel ???????? pretty sure she just said it’s about bringing more people to the table ??????? “she’s ruining her one movie by excluding a wide comic book movie audience” what ????? SHE’S TRYING TO OPEN UP THE AUDIENCE TO A MOVIE INDUSTRY THAT IS PRIMARILY DOMINATED BY WHITE MEN. WHY IS TRYING TO BE MORE INCLUSIVE SUCH AN ISSUE ???????

blog.name: loveandsupportforcaptainmarvel
blog.title: Captain Marvel Doesn't Care For Your Sexism
blog.description: Blog dedicated to standing up to the hate directed at Captain Marvel

summary: Men: “We have launched an attack on Captain Marvel, getting the ratings on Rotten Tomatoes to get so bad that they’ve had to be...
body:
Men: “We have launched an attack on Captain Marvel, getting the ratings on Rotten Tomatoes to get so bad that they’ve had to be shut down. We continue to attack the comments sections on YouTube and anybody who leaves a positive comment. We’ve taken to social media and have banded together to boycott this movie and Brie Larson. We have out-powered you, you can do nothing.”

Me and my followers:

reblog.comment:

We continue to attack the comments sections on YouTube and anybody who leaves a positive comment. We’ve taken to social media and have banded together to boycott this movie and Brie Larson. We have out-powered you, you can do nothing.”

Me and my followers:

blog.title: Captain Marvel Doesn't Care For Your Sexism

summary: This is why movies starring women are important. Little girls see themselves in these women and see that they can become like...
caption: This is why movies starring women are important. Little girls see themselves in these women and see that they can become like them. They see that nothing stands in their way of achieving their dreams. They see that women are powerful, intelligent, kind, strong, caring, ambitious, heroes, independent, leaders, talented, and capable of doing amazing things.

reblog.comment: This is why movies starring women are important. Little girls see themselves in these women and see that they can become like them. They see that nothing stands in their way of achieving their dreams. They see that women are powerful, intelligent, kind, strong, caring, ambitious, heroes, independent, leaders, talented, and capable of doing amazing things.

trail.content_raw: This is why movies starring women are important. Little girls see themselves in these women and see that they can become like them. They see that nothing stands in their way of achieving their dreams. They see that women are powerful, intelligent, kind, strong, caring, ambitious, heroes, independent, leaders, talented, and capable of doing amazing things.

They see that nothing stands in their way of achieving their dreams. They see that women are powerful, intelligent, kind, strong, caring, ambitious, heroes, independent, leaders, talented, and capable of doing amazing things.

blog.name: marvelmarch
blog.title: Marvel March
blog.description: A creative month long challenge to explore the world of marvel and celebrate characters we love ❤️

summary: Marvel March Prompts in Text Format
title: Marvel March Prompts in Text Format
body:
Here are the full prompt lists for anyone who wants to take part in Marvel March but relies on a text reader app or has trouble displaying/reading images:

General Prompts:

1 favourite marvel charcter(s)
2 favourite comic series
3 favourite marvel movie
4 favourite comic panel
5 least favourite marvel character(s)
6 first marvel character you ever saw
7 favourite villain
8 favourite marvel building/location/planet
9 marvel character you identify most with
10 favourite marvel costume
11 favourite MCU interpretation of a character
12 favourite pet avenger/animal from a marvel series
13 least favourite villain
14 favourite team
15 a comic character you’d like to see in the MCU
16 a character you’d like to know more about
17 least favourite team
18 favourite movie scene
19 favourite duo
20 first comic you read
21 favourite marvel cartoon show
22 favourite mutant
23 favourite cosmic charcater
24 favourite avenger
25 favourite inhuman
26 favourite street level character
27 favourite joke character
28 favourite ship (friendship or romantic)
29 a character you’d like to see brought back
30 saddest death
31 a character you just want an excuse to draw!

Comics:

1 Favourite character
2 Favourite comic series
3 First comic you remember reading
4 Favourite team
5 Favourite mutant
6 Favourite comic panel
7 A title you’d like to see revived
8 Least favourite character
9 Favourite villain
10 Favourite pet avenger/marvel animal
11 Favourite location (building, planet, country etc)
12 Favourite Avenger
13 Saddest death
14 Least favourite villain
15 Comic character you identify with most
16 Favourite team (oops I accidentally duplicated this prompt - second favourite team then, I guess! Sorry!)
17 Favourite street level character
18 A character you’d like to see brought back
19 Favourite ship (friendship or romantic)
20 Favourite joke character
21 A character you’d like to get their own comic title
22 Favourite inhuman
23 Worst comic title you’ve read
24 Favourite comic costume
25 Weirdest comic you’ve ever read
26 Favourite cover
27 Worst comic costume
28 Favourite cosmic character
29 Favourite duo
30 A dead character you’d like to see revived
31 A character you just want an excuse to draw!

MCU:

1 Favourite movie character
2 First Marvel movie you watched
3 Favourite Marvel movie
4 Favourite Marvel TV show
5 Favourite movie team
6 Favourite movie villain
7 Favourite MCU costume
8 Funniest Marvel movie
9 Personal least favourite movie character
10 Favourite cgi character
11 Favourite ship (friendship or romantic)
12 Saddest movie/tv death
13 Favourite tv show villain
14 Worst movie character interpretation 

15 The last Marvel movie you watched

16 Worst Marvel movie
17 Favourite original character made for the MCU
18 Favourite movie scene
19 Favourite location (building/planet/country etc)
20 Favourite comic relief character
21 Character you’d like to see brought back
22 Favourite Netflix show
23 Funniest movie/tv scene
24 Favourite duo
25 Favourite movie series
26 Favourite titles/credits
27 Ateam up you’d like to see
28 A character who deserves their own tv show/movie
29 Worst movie or tv show villain
30 Favourite post credits scene
31 A character you just want an excuse to draw!

IMPORTANT NOTES:

- I made a mistake in comic prompts and put favourite team twice. I did check and recheck many times but that one slipped through the net, i’m sorry! Feel free to use one of them for your second favourite team or maybe villainous team!

- if I’ve made any other mistakes, I apologise whole heartedly! This should just all be in good fun though so just enjoy them :)

- feel free to interpret prompts in different ways to suit your own enjoyment of marvel. For example, in the MCU version feel free to stick to focusing on either movies or tv shows, and if you don’t watch any of the tie-in series ignore those questions and pick from another prompt set or add a question you’d personally like to answer instead. Like I said, it’s all in the name of fun

- Marvel March is an art challenge but can be interpreted in any way you choose, you can write your answers or use screenshots or gifs etc. It would just be awesome to see some other people joining in and enjoying the challenge

- tag your posts with marvel march so we can check out your responses to the prompts!

That’s all for now - please reblog and share with your followers if you can!

31 A character you just want an excuse to draw!

MCU:

1 Favourite movie character
2 First Marvel movie you watched
3 Favourite Marvel movie
4 Favourite Marvel TV show
5 Favourite movie team
6 Favourite movie villain
7 Favourite MCU costume
8 Funniest Marvel movie
9 Personal least favourite movie character
10 Favourite cgi character
11 Favourite ship (friendship or romantic)
12 Saddest movie/tv death
13 Favourite tv show villain
14 Worst movie character interpretation 

15 The last Marvel movie you watched

16 Worst Marvel movie
17 Favourite original character made for the MCU
18 Favourite movie scene
19 Favourite location (building/planet/country etc)
20 Favourite comic relief character
21 Character you’d like to see brought back
22 Favourite Netflix show
23 Funniest movie/tv scene
24 Favourite duo
25 Favourite movie series
26 Favourite titles/credits
27 Ateam up you’d like to see
28 A character who deserves their own tv show/movie
29 Worst movie or tv show villain
30 Favourite post credits scene
31 A character you just want an excuse to draw!

IMPORTANT NOTES:

- I made a mistake in comic prompts and put favourite team twice. I did check and recheck many times but that one slipped through the net, i’m sorry! Feel free to use one of them for your second favourite team or maybe villainous team!

- if I’ve made any other mistakes, I apologise whole heartedly! This should just all be in good fun though so just enjoy them :)

- feel free to interpret prompts in different ways to suit your own enjoyment of marvel. For example, in the MCU version feel free to stick to focusing on either movies or tv shows, and if you don’t watch any of the tie-in series ignore those questions and pick from another prompt set or add a question you’d personally like to answer instead. Like I said, it’s all in the name of fun

- Marvel March is an art challenge but can be interpreted in any way you choose, you can write your answers or use screenshots or gifs etc. It would just be awesome to see some other people joining in and enjoying the challenge

- tag your posts with marvel march so we can check out your responses to the prompts!

That’s all for now - please reblog and share with your followers if you can!
trail.content:
Here are the full prompt lists for anyone who wants to take part in Marvel March but relies on a text reader app or has trouble displaying/reading images:

General Prompts:

2 favourite comic series

5 least favourite marvel character(s)

- if I’ve made any other mistakes, I apologise whole heartedly! This should just all be in good fun though so just enjoy them :)

- feel free to interpret prompts in different ways to suit your own enjoyment of marvel. For example, in the MCU version feel free to stick to focusing on either movies or tv shows, and if you don’t watch any of the tie-in series ignore those questions and pick from another prompt set or add a question you’d personally like to answer instead. - Marvel March is an art challenge but can be interpreted in any way you choose, you can write your answers or use screenshots or gifs etc. It would just be awesome to see some other people joining in and enjoying the challenge
